text: Vicarage Meadows is a Site of Special Scientific Interest near Abergwesyn, Powys, Wales. The site, located close to the Nant Irfon National Nature Reserve, has unimproved acid grassland on which grow the small-white orchid, the fragrant orchid (Gymnadenia conopsea), the Greater Butterfly orchid (Platanthera chlorantha) and the Wood Bitter-vetch (Vicia orobus). The site is grazed by Exmoor ponies. ==See also== *List of Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Brecknock ==References== ==External links== *Vicarage Meadows Site of Special Scientific Interest - 'Your Special Site and its Future', Countryside Council for Wales *Brecknock Wildlife Trust - Vicarage Meadows Nature Reserve *NBN gateway for Vicarage Meadows, National Biodiversity Network Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Brecknock Category:Meadows in Wales
title: Vicarage Meadows
